content.p: Manipulate the expression below until it has the form r \ln( {{p}} ) for some rational number r. \ln\left( {{arg11}} \right) + \ln\left( {{arg21}} \right)

content.p:
Manipulate the expression
\ln\left[ {{f}} \right]
into a sum/difference of terms of the form r \ln(f(x)) where each r is an integer, and each f(x) is an irreducible algebraic expression.

Find all real solutions for x in the equation below.
\log_{ {{b}} }\left( {{log1}} \right) + \log_{ {{b}} }\left( {{log2}} \right) = \log_{ {{b}} }\left( {{d}} \right)
Explain and demonstrate how you found your solutions, or if no solutions exist, explain and demonstrate why not.
